intro: Tofieldia nuda, commonly known as the naked tofieldia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Poaceae family, commonly referred to as the grass family. This plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white to pale green flowers. Tofieldia nuda typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and disturbed soils.
